Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, such as a forest and a pond.
The student can include different types of living things in each habitat drawing, such as plants and animals.
The student can represent various plants in the habitat drawings, like trees, grasses, and flowers.
The student can include different animals in the habitats, such as squirrels, lizards, ants, and fish.
The student can show how some living things are specific to certain habitats, like fish in the pond and squirrels in the forest.
The student can compare the types of living things found in each habitat through their drawings.
The student can organize and label the drawings to clearly represent plant and animal diversity.
